snippet: Partnering with an international nonprofit group, the Nigerian government plans to improve access to pain medications for cancer and AIDS patients.
abstract: Nigeria's health minister announces that the country will buy 55 pounds of morphine for the nation’s hospitals and form an alliance with a new nonprofit organization, the Global Access to Pain Relief Initiative; organization was formed in 2010 to address the fact that millions of poor people die in severe pain because their countries have drug-trafficking laws that severely limit opiate imports.
lead_paragraph: Partnering with an international nonprofit group, the Nigerian government plans to improve access to pain medications for cancer and AIDS patients.
